articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: ‘Panic situation:’ As coronavirus idles China’s factories, desperation grows for workers, clients and owners
articles.description: Thousands of businesses are in limbo, waiting to hear from local authorities on when they can resume operations.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Carnival cruise ship is running out of ports after 4 nations block entry on coronavirus fears
articles.description: It's more bad news for Carnival, whose Diamond Princess and its 3,700 passengers are quarantined in the port of Yokohama as authorities battle an increasing number of infections on board.

articles.author: Karen Yuan
articles.title: The dreaded ‘black swan’—and what that rare event means for the markets
articles.description: The coronavirus outbreak has decimated Chinese demand for oil by up to 3 million barrels per day. The impact can be felt beyond crude.

articles.author: eamonbarrett
articles.title: Singapore urges calm—but its tourism industry is being pummeled by the coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The Singapore Airshow advocates a "no contact" policy, while a business conference is investigated as a possible "super spreader" event.

articles.author: Naomi Xu Elegant
articles.title: Can you catch the coronavirus twice? Answers to 5 pressing questions about the worldwide outbreak
articles.description: Two experts, a virologist and an infectious disease specialist, break down the basics.

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: How a cruise ship turns into a coronavirus breeding ground
articles.description: For passengers, it began as a carefree voyage. For the coronavirus, it was a chance to run rampant.
